definition: lit. one spot (on the leopard)/fig. one small item in a big scheme
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
spot/colored patch/stripe/spotted/striped/variegated
lit. to glimpse just one spot (of the panther) (idiom)/fig. to get an inkling of the whole picture
lit. see one spot on a leopard (idiom); fig. a restricted view

sentences.english: Mia loves little creatures, this also proves it.
sentences.chinese: 米米很爱小动物，从这吃鱼头也可见一斑。

sentences.english: It is a fine example of contract civilization of medieval England's boroughs.
sentences.chinese: 这点可通过中古英国城市契约窥见一斑。

sentences.english: This famous quote manifests the importance of understanding silence in human intercourses.
sentences.chinese: 理解沉默的意义对人类交往的重要性由此可见一斑。

sentences.english: The shift in attitudes is also apparent in graduate school enrollment.
sentences.chinese: 这种转变在研究生院的招生中也可见一斑。

sentences.english: Its features were partly visible in the 2005 British parliamentary elections.
sentences.chinese: 有些特征可在2005年英国的议会选举中略见一斑。

sentences.english: Even this lengthy list is not exhaustive. The ambition is clearly remarkable.
sentences.chinese: 即使这么长的清单也没有列全，其雄心可见一斑。

sentences.english: Zhu Jun counterpoises in the regnant style of 9 cities and speech, see one spot.
sentences.chinese: 朱骏在九城的统治风格与话语权，可见一斑。

sentences.english: Just consider the raw increase in the number of journals.
sentences.chinese: 只要看看科研期刊数量的增长就可略见一斑了。

sentences.english: Of course, the monthly statistics only tell part of the story.
sentences.chinese: 当然，一个月的数据仅够窥豹一斑。

sentences.english: Mohammedan civilization, see one spot again from this.
sentences.chinese: 伊斯兰文明，由此又可见一斑。

sentences.english: Those future events are glimpsed in the sestet of this poem, in the final six lines.
sentences.chinese: 未来之事在后六行中可见一斑，在最后的六行。

sentences.english: Tong Jia Shi status of forces is obvious.
sentences.chinese: 佟佳氏的势力地位由此可见一斑。

sentences.english: Would a later train get you to work on time?
sentences.chinese: 要是坐晚一斑的火车能使你不迟到么？

sentences.english: Pull one hair and move watch one spot all over and see whole picture.
sentences.chinese: 牵一发而动全身观一斑而见全豹。

sentences.english: Here is displayed the true spirit of popery .
sentences.chinese: 教皇制度的庐山真面目，于此可见一斑。
素食论的虚伪，从此可以略见一斑。

definition: the full picture (i.e. the whole situation)/panorama
lit. to glimpse just one spot (of the panther) (idiom)/fig. to get an inkling of the whole picture
it goes to show that/one can see
from this, it can be seen that...
to peep/to pry into
variant of 窺|窥[kui1]
lit. to see a leopard through a narrow tube (idiom); fig. to miss the big picture
it can clearly be seen (that this is the case)/it is (thus) clear/clear/visible
to look at sth through a bamboo tube/to have a restricted view
lit. see one spot on a leopard (idiom); fig. a restricted view
to find out about/to discover
needless to say/it goes without saying
especially
in this way/so
it goes without saying/it is self-evident
to not need dwell on (idiom)
evidently/clearly/no wonder/knowable
